Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2008 12:17PM Karentoo wrote: gel or saline filled implants?  how do you decide? when I met with  my PS (only one meeting so far) have pre-op on Dec 31st, I was able to look at gel and saline, was able to touch and feel them.  The saline just seemed like a ziploc bag full of water, the gel felt more natural.  any input?

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2008 11:44AM Karentoo wrote: Hi, thanks for all of the great information. I went to gym this morning, trying to get all in I can before the 8th.  I really really am trying to keep my spirit up.  IMy spirit is important to me and I do not want this to cause me to loose my spirit.  I have the Christmas decorations down, I have a sense of urgency to "get things done."  I am headed out to find me shorts for under the "gown".  I will spend the next week or so preparing physically and mentally.  All of you are angels, it helps so much to be able to come here to vent and talk.

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2008 04:36PM Karentoo wrote: I too am having bilateral mx in January, scheduled for Jan 8.  I have tried to wrap my heart and my brain around all of this.  Have been a bit overwhelmed.  I am just trying to understand some of the terminology, what to expect etc.  I have good days and bad days.  I sometimes have fear, other times I have peace.  The one thing I tell myself daily is that I am blessed that mine has been detected so early and I just want the cancer gone. I would love to know what to take to the hospital also.   I have gotten some button up pjs, as I know it will be difficult for pullover and slippers.  For now, I am just trying to prepare myself mentally.

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2009 07:52PM Karentoo wrote: Well... tomorrow is the day of my surgery, I am packed and heading to bed. I think I have everything.  When I wake tomorrow after surgery... I am praying this will all be behind me. Will post as soon as I can when I return home.
Posts.Title: January Mastectomy crusader1 bettelou68

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2009 02:27PM Karentoo wrote: Hi, I am one week out post op, had bilateral mx on Jan 8th.  Feeling pretty good.  Showered the first time on the second day with help of my hubby.  Showering now alone but with stool in shower.  Can't do alot yet but I will get there.  Have my reconstruction  started (expanders), go Friday for follow up/check up.  This has been very difficult to go through.  I had my SNL biopsy during surgery, all came back clear.  So as for treatment, no chemo, no radiation, may need Tamoxfin for 5 years.  Meeting with oncologist next Friday also.  That may just be precautionary thing.  As of now, cancer free.  I am looking forward to my reconstruction process.  It  will be worth it.

But I know home would be better place as soon as possible. :)
